widgets_values: Your final result video will be shown here.

## Model links

**text_encoders**

- [umt5_xxl_fp8_e4m3fn_scaled.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Comfy-Org/Wan_2.2_ComfyUI_Repackaged/resolve/main/split_files/text_encoders/umt5_xxl_fp8_e4m3fn_scaled.safetensors)

**model**

- [DaSiWa WAN 2.2 S2V 14B Lightspeed](https://civitai.com/models/2151205)

**audio encoder**
- [Wav2Vec2 FP16](https://huggingface.co/Comfy-Org/Wan_2.2_ComfyUI_Repackaged/tree/main/split_files/audio_encoders)
   
  OR

- [Wav2Vec2 FP8]()

**vae**

- [wan_2.1_vae.safetensors](https://huggingface.co/Comfy-Org/Wan_2.2_ComfyUI_Repackaged/blob/main/split_files/vae/wan_2.1_vae.safetensors)


## Model Storage Location

```
ComfyUI/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄüìÇ models/

‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ wan2.2_s2v_14B_fp8_scaled.safetensors
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄüìÇ text_encoders/
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ umt5_xxl_fp8_e4m3fn_scaled.safetensors 
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄüìÇ audio_encoders/ # Create one if you can't find this folder
‚îÇ   ‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ wav2vec2_large_english_fp16.safetensors 
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄüìÇ vae/
‚îÇ       ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ wan_2.1_vae.safetensors
```

nodes.title: Batch Note
widgets_values:
Set to "1" by default. Will add +1 batch, expanding the video to double the length.
+2 would triple the length and so on.

This should match your audio length!

nodes.title: Resolution note
widgets_values:
### Here are some resolutions from low to high. ### Low res for weaker computers and fast samples.
### 1‚ÄØ:‚ÄØ1 (width‚ÄØ:‚ÄØheight = 1) | # | Width‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØHeight | | |---|----------------|----------------| | 1 | 480‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ480 | fast samples | | 2 | 640‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ640 | low quality | | 3 | 768‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ768 | some artifacts | | 4 | 800‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ800 | better details | | 5 | 880‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ880 | good | | 6 | 960‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ960 | *(WAN‚ÄØ2.2 native)* | ### 3‚ÄØ:‚ÄØ4 (width‚ÄØ:‚ÄØheight = 0.75) | # | Width‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØHeight | | |---|----------------|----------------| | 1 | 416‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ544 | fast samples | | 2 | 560‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ720 | low quality | | 3 | 672‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ864 | some artifacts | | 4 | 720‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ912 | better details | | 5 | 784‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ1008 | good | | 6 | 848‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ1088 | *(WAN‚ÄØ2.2 native)* |
Repeat the same pattern to place the other two tables side-by-side (3rd column pair):
### 2‚ÄØ:‚ÄØ3 (width‚ÄØ:‚ÄØheight = 0.6667) | # | Width‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØHeight | | |---|----------------|----------------| | 1 | 384‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ576 | fast samples | | 2 | 528‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ768 | low quality | | 3 | 624‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ912 | some artifacts | | 4 | 656‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ960 | better details | | 5 | 736‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ1072 | good | | 6 | 784‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ1136 | *(WAN‚ÄØ2.2 native)* | ### 9‚ÄØ:‚ÄØ16 (width‚ÄØ:‚ÄØheight = 0.5625) | # | Width‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØHeight | | |---|----------------|----------------| | 1 | 368‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ624 | fast samples | | 2 | 480‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ848 | low quality | | 3 | 576‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ1008 | some artifacts | | 4 | 608‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ1072 | better details | | 5 | 672‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ1184 | good | | 6 | 720‚ÄØ√ó‚ÄØ1264 | *(WAN‚ÄØ2.2 native)* |

nodes.title: Changelog
widgets_values:
## Requirements
- https://github.com/Kosinkadink/ComfyUI-VideoHelperSuite
- https://github.com/rgthree/rgthree-comfy
- https://github.com/Artificial-Sweetener/comfyui-WhiteRabbit  
  *packaging, torchlanc*
- https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-KJNodes
- https://github.com/yolain/ComfyUI-Easy-Use

---

## Features

- üß© **Automatic aspect‚Äëratio fitting**
- ‚ôæÔ∏è **True infinite** batch as long as you want 
- üñºÔ∏è **Anti 1st frame burn** -  Latent cut
- ‚ú® **Ultra‚Äëfast, color‚Äëcorrect upscaling** (torchlanc)
- üîñ **Bookmark-Shortcuts** with number keys
- Video resolution always matches optimal Div16 WAN 2.2 resolutions
- ü´• **Watermark** option
- üì¢ **Soundmark** option
- **Separated upscale logic** for VRAM saving

---

## Changes
 - Added a counter for the position index of the loop
- Reorganized some nodes
- Separated upscale feature
- Fitting resolution mentions inside the note
## Fixes
 - Mentioned audio_encoder in Model links

nodes.title: Lora Note
widgets_values: Set your wav file here. The length should fit your total final video length in seconds.
Just the standard WAN 2.2 negatives. Leave as is.

nodes.title: Video codec, CRF and features
widgets_values:
### üé• H.265 (MP4) CRF Recommendations for WAN 2.2 + RIFE
---

| Purpose | CRF | Notes |
|----------|-----|-------|
| Master / Archival | 19 | Nearly lossless; best for grading or editing |
| Final Render | 20‚Äì22 | Ideal quality-to-size balance |
| Web / Social | 23‚Äì25 | Lighter files, still decent |
| Previews / Tests | 25‚Äì27 | Quick generation, visible compression |

---


üí° *Tip:* For AI-generated videos, CRF 20-22 gives extreme good results with minimal size. H265 is in every way superior to H264 - better compression, better motion estimation, better colors.

nodes.title: BASIC settings explanation
widgets_values:
## Usage 1. Set checkpoints 2. Set Clip + VAE 3. (optional) add LoRAs 4. Enable Featuras you want at the "Features - Switch" 5. Tune any parameter to your liking under "BASIC SETTINGS" 6. Add images you need 7. Generate ## BASIC settings group | Setting | Default / Example | Description | |---|---:|---| | **VAE** | same as WAN 2.1 | Still using the same VAE as WAN 2.1. | | **CLIP** | standard encoder | Use your preferred standard CLIP text encoder. No CLIP Vision H ‚Äî not trained/implemented in WAN 2.2 and weights are disabled. | | **CLIP device** | "cpu" or "default" | CLIP can be offloaded to CPU for VRAM savings ‚Üí device = "cpu". If VRAM is sufficient, use device = "default" for faster inference. | | **Checkpoint** | Safetensors | Choose the type of Checkpoint to use. Wan 2.2 S2V uses a single safetensors checkpoint. | | **LoRAs** | none | Try without LoRA first for a baseline. Add LoRAs to your liking for stylistic/behavioral tweaks. | | **Seed** | 333 | -1 ‚Üí random outcome every run. Set a specific seed to reproduce the same outcome. | | **FPS** | 16 | Frames per second for videos. S2V is trained on 16. | | **Frames** | 49‚Äì113 | Total frames determine video length. Examples: 3s=49, 4s=65, 5s=81, 6s=97, 7s=113. Math: (Seconds * 16) + 1 = total frames. | | **Feature switch** | off/on | Enable features you want to use. | | **CRF** | 19 | Video compression level. 19 is near-lossless (default). | | **Steps total** | 4 | Total steps - node handles step math. More steps ‚Üí higher quality but longer generation. Use even numbers. | | **CFG** | 1.0 | Controls prompt adherence. Use 1-1.5. 1 disables/ignores the negative prompt. 1.0 is needed for speed-up's like 4/8-step models/LoRAs | | **Sigma Shift** | 10 | Adjust and test; WAN 2.2 S2V valid in range 8‚Äì12. | | **Video resolution** | #4 resolution | Affects sampling time, VRAM and RAM usage. Low resolution significantly introduces artifacts with WAN S2V.| | **Upscale** | 2x | Final resolution = 2 √ó start resolution while maintaining aspect ratio. No morph; aspect-correct to optimal WAN resolution. | | **Extra batches** | off | Add extra rounds with the same settings to infinitely extend the video.
Math: Set frames + (set frames * extra batches) | | **Loop count index** |displays a value | Should display the already done extra batch cycles to estimate how much is left. | | **Positive prompt** | none | Write your positive prompt!
1) Brief description of the setting/appearance
2) Actions, motions, story
3) Camera composition
CFG 1 normally disables/ignores the negative prompt! NAG effectively enables negative prompting on CFG 1.| | **Negative prompt** | none | Write what you would like to exclude. Works only if CFG > 1 or NAG is enabled | | **NAG** | off | This will use your negative condition and concat it with the standard WAN AI negative prompt for convenience.
If you do not want this, just disable the standard negative node.
‚ö†Ô∏èNAG needs a lot of VRAM, so if you do not need this. Just let it be disabled. | | **Interpolation** | off | This will interpolate your video to double fps at the end. Interpolated FPS = 2 √ó FPS. | | **Watermark** | off | Here you can set a watermark image and calibrate the settings to your liking. | | **Soundmark** | off | Here you can set a soundmark image and calibrate the settings to your liking. | | **Color match** | 0.4 | This will try to match the color from the initial image to the samples. The color match algorithms default is set by default to '0.4'. Feel free to test other strength. |
